intro: Thuranthos nagarjunae, commonly known as the Nagarjunan thuranthos, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within dense forests. Its leaves are elliptical and have a smooth, glossy surface. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
